title: Beef Wellington
description: An elegant British classic featuring tender beef fillet wrapped in mushrooms and puff pastry, perfect for special occasions.
steps: Season beef with salt and pepper. Sear in olive oil on all sides, then brush with mustard.
Sauté mushrooms, shallot, and garlic in butter until dry. Cool.
Lay out prosciutto slices, spread mushroom mixture, then place beef on top.
Roll prosciutto around beef, chill for 15 minutes.
Wrap beef in puff pastry, brush with egg wash.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 35-40 minutes until golden.

title: Classic Burger
description: Juicy, flavorful homemade burgers with all the classic toppings - a crowd-pleasing favorite for cookouts.
steps: Gently mix beef with salt, pepper, and Worcestershire sauce.
Form into 4 equal patties, make a slight indentation in the center.
Grill or cook on high heat for 3-4 minutes per side.
Add cheese if using, cover to melt.
Toast buns lightly.
Assemble with your favorite toppings and condiments.

title: Chicken Parmesan
description: Crispy breaded chicken topped with marinara and melted cheese - a comforting Italian-American classic.
steps: Pound chicken to even thickness, season with salt and pepper.
Dredge in flour, then egg, then breadcrumb-Parmesan mixture.
Heat oil in pan, cook chicken until golden, about 4-5 minutes per side.
Top with marinara sauce and mozzarella.
Broil for 2-3 minutes until cheese is bubbly.
Serve with pasta or salad.

title: Southern Fried Chicken
description: Crispy, golden fried chicken with a perfectly seasoned crust - a Southern staple that's always a hit.
steps: Soak chicken in buttermilk for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Mix flour and spices in a large bowl.
Dredge chicken in flour mixture, shaking off excess.
Heat oil to 350°F (175°C) in a deep fryer or heavy pot.
Fry chicken in batches for 12-15 minutes until golden and cooked through.
Drain on a wire rack, serve hot.

title: French Omelet
description: A light, fluffy classic French omelet with perfect texture - quick enough for weekday breakfasts but elegant enough for brunch.
steps: Whisk eggs with salt, pepper, and cream if using.
Melt butter in non-stick pan over medium-low heat.
Pour in eggs, stir gently with a rubber spatula.
As eggs set, tilt pan to let uncooked egg flow to edges.
When mostly set but still slightly runny, add fillings if using.
Fold omelet in half or roll, slide onto plate, garnish with chives.

title: Margherita Pizza
description: Simple Neapolitan-style pizza with fresh mozzarella, basil, and tomato sauce - letting quality ingredients shine.
steps: Preheat oven with pizza stone to 500°F (260°C) for 1 hour.
Stretch dough to 12-inch round on cornmeal-dusted peel.
Spread thin layer of sauce, leaving border for crust.
Arrange mozzarella slices evenly.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden.
Remove from oven, drizzle with olive oil, add fresh basil, and slice.
